dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4179 IH: LWCF Parity for Territories and DC Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Bordallo (for herself, Miss González-Colón of Puerto Rico, Ms. Norton, Mrs. Radewagen, Mr. Sablan, and Ms. Plaskett) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend title 54, United States Code, to apply the same apportionment formula to territories and the District of Columbia as is applied to States with respect to amounts made available for State purposes from the Land and Water Conservation Fund, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the LWCF Parity for Territories and DC Act.

paragraph.text: Chapter 2003 of title 54, United States Code, establishes the Land and Water Conservation Fund and defines the term State to include the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands.
According to the Bureau of the Census, the estimated population of—

subparagraph.text: the District of Columbia currently exceeds the populations of two States; and
Puerto Rico currently exceeds the populations of 21 States.

section.header: Parity for territories and the District of Columbia
section.text: Section 200305(b) of title 54, United States Code, is amended by striking paragraph (5).
